Fix init.js autoMerge: exec makes appended shim unreachable
description: When prove_it init autoMerges into an existing git hook that contains 'exec' (e.g., bd-shim v1), the appended prove_it section is unreachable dead code. exec replaces the shell process, so lines after it never execute. prove_it only runs if the chained tool (bd) internally delegates back. When bd's chain times out, prove_it is completely bypassed and the commit proceeds unchecked. Fix: detect exec in existing hooks and insert prove_it BEFORE the exec line, or use a wrapper strategy.

Harden coverage reviewer prompt against greenfield rationalization
description: The review:test_coverage builtin prompt allows the LLM reviewer to rationalize away missing test coverage for 'greenfield' or 'early stage' projects. In the sugoi_tv incident, 1,456 lines of production code passed coverage review with zero tests because the reviewer decided requiring tests would be 'unreasonable' for a new app — despite the project having script/test and script/test_fast infrastructure. The prompt should explicitly state that if test infrastructure exists, the standard applies regardless of project age.
